page.title: 20Athletics - Running, Jogging
page.content: Athletics - Running, Jogging The number of people who keep fit by running or by jogging is a notable feature of village life. The Fun Runs which started in 1976 with about 30 people, are the focal point of this activity. They start from Westley Heights and follow a picturesque route through woods and fields to finish at The Bell. Up to 300 people take part in each of the 6 runs held every year including scores of men, women and children from the Village. The tea from The Bell has won the Pub Champs. in the Sunday Times National Fun Run each year since 1981. The Horndon 10km road race run at the Feast and Fayre and the half marathon are now annual races. The sight of the villagers competing with famous athletes inspires others to look after themselves by jogging or running.
